channel.title: About the Web category
channel.description:
There are currently two ways in which Ren-C is built to WebAssembly:
* The "ReplPad" in-browser rich console experience. It provides everything from [docking windows to rich editors](https://forum.rebol.info/t/visual-parse-on-the-web-has-arrived/1837), with the full power of the browser available. This is built via Emscripten, and integrates with JavaScript.
* (See also [Language Bridging](https://forum.rebol.info/c/development/language-bridging) category for discussions of JavaScript integration)
* As a [WASI blob of .wasm](https://forum.rebol.info/t/ren-c-is-now-on-the-clouds-with-wasi/1854), designed to run cross-platform in Wasm runtimes.
While native builds for Windows/Mac/Linux are still pursued as a necessary part of the further development of Ren-C, these WebAssembly targets are the primary focus of Ren-C's "deliverables".

item.title: About the Web category
item.dc:creator: gchiu
item.description:
There are currently two ways in which Ren-C is built to WebAssembly:

  • The "ReplPad" in-browser rich console experience. It provides everything from docking windows to rich editors, with the full power of the browser available. This is built via Emscripten, and integrates with JavaScript.

    • (See also Language Bridging category for discussions of JavaScript integration)

  • As a WASI blob of .wasm, designed to run cross-platform in Wasm runtimes.

While native builds for Windows/Mac/Linux are still pursued as a necessary part of the further development of Ren-C, these WebAssembly targets are the primary focus of Ren-C's "deliverables".
